item.title: Judy add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "God gives the nuts, but he does not crack them." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Judy add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: Judy add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "How is it possible to find meaning in a finite world, given my waist and shirt size?" -- Woody Allen

item.title: Judy add a quote by Soren Kierkegaard
item.description: "A fire broke out backstage in a theatre. The clown came out to warn the public; they thought it was a joke and applauded. He repeated it; the acclaim was even greater. I think that's just how the world will come to an end: to general applause from wits who believe it's a joke." -- Soren Kierkegaard

item.title: Judy add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "Once you label me you negate me." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: Judy add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Whenever I’m asked why Southern writers particularly have a penchant for writing about freaks, I say it is because we are still able to recognize one." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Judy add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The writer should never be ashamed of staring. There is nothing that does not require his attention." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Judy add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Anything that comes out of the South is going to be called grotesque by the northern reader, unless it is grotesque, in which case it is going to be called realistic." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Judy add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I became insane, with long intervals of horrible sanity." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Judy add a quote by Bohumil Hrabal
item.description: "It's interesting how young poets think of death while old fogies think of girls." -- Bohumil Hrabal

item.title: Judy add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Right or wrong, it's very pleasant to break something from time to time." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Judy add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "I have the true feeling of myself only when I am unbearably unhappy." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Judy add a quote by franz kafka
item.description: "Slept, awoke, slept, awoke, miserable life." -- franz kafka

item.title: Judy add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "There is an infinite amount of hope in the universe ... but not for us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Judy add a quote by Kafka, Franzv
item.description: "Love is, that you are the knife which I plunge into myself." -- Kafka, Franzv

item.title: Judy add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "You do not need to leave your room. Remain sitting at your table and listen. Do not even listen, simply wait, be quiet, still and solitary. The world will freely offer itself to you to be unmasked, it has no choice, it will roll in ecstasy at your feet." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Judy add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "What do I have in common with Jews? I don't even have anything in common with myself. " -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Judy add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "This is very important -- to take leisure time. Pace is the essence. Without stopping entirely and doing nothing at all for great periods, you're gonna lose everything...just to do nothing at all, very, very important. And how many people do this in modern society? Very few. That's why they're all totally mad, frustrated, angry and hateful." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Judy add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "I was a man who thrived on solitude; without it I was like another man without food or water. Each day without solitude weakened me. I took no pride in my solitude; but I was dependent on it. The darkness of the room was like sunlight to me." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Judy add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description:
"unless it comes out of your soul like a rocket, unless being still would drive you to madness or suicide or murder, don't do it. unless the sun inside you is burning your gut, don't do it.
when it is truly time, and if you have been chosen, it will do it by itself and it will keep on doing it until you die or it dies in you.
there is no other way.
and there never was." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Judy add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Judy add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "If we listened to our intellect we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go in business because we'd be cynical: "It's gonna go wrong." Or "She's going to hurt me." Or,"I've had a couple of bad love affairs, so therefore . . ." Well, that's nonsense. You're going to miss life. You've got to jump off the cliff all the time and build your wings on the way down." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Judy add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Stuff your eyes with wonder, he said, live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Judy add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must write every single day of your life... You must lurk in libraries and climb the stacks like ladders to sniff books like perfumes and wear books like hats upon your crazy heads... may you be in love every day for the next 20,000 days. And out of that love, remake a world." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Judy add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Don't think. Thinking is the enemy of creativity. It's self-conscious and anything self-conscious is lousy. You can't "try" to do things. You simply "must" do things." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Judy add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You have to know how to accept rejection and reject acceptance." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Judy add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "I believe more in the scissors than I do in the pencil." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Judy add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "all his prayers of the past had been simple concrete requests: God, give me a bicycle, a knife with seven blades, a box of oil paints. Only how, how, could you say something so indefinite, so meaningless as this: God, let me be loved." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Judy add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Shoot, boy, the country's just fulla folks what knows everything, and don't understand nothing, just fullofem." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Judy add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "I knew Faulkner very well. He was a great friend of mine. Well, as much as you could be a friend of his, unless you were a fourteen-year-old nymphet. Then you could be a great friend!" -- Truman Capote
